question: The Kittur Rebellion (1824-29) led by whom in Karnataka?
explanation: The Kittur Rebellion (1824-29): The British prevented the adopted son of the chief of Kittur (in Karnataka) from assuming power by taking over the administration, that resulted in form of revolt. The Kittur uprisings was led by Chennamma, the widow of the chief. The rebels declared Kittur an independent state before being crushed by the British.
